title: Fix Student Dashboard quick actions to navigate to AI Tutor and Exam Generator pages

requirements.text: Make the Student Dashboard “AI Tutor” and “Exam Generator” quick-action cards navigate to their respective pages when clicked (AI Tutor → Tutor page, Exam Generator → Exam Generator page) using the existing AppShell in-app navigation state.

quotes: in dashboard if student clicks ai tutor and exam generator it needs to redirect to its respective page,update the code accordingly pls

acceptanceCriteria: When logged in as a student and viewing the Student Dashboard, clicking the “AI Tutor” quick-action card navigates to the Tutor page (the same view as selecting Tutor in the header).

When logged in as a student and viewing the Student Dashboard, clicking the “Exam Generator” quick-action card navigates to the Exam Generator page (the same view as selecting Exam Generator in the header).
Navigation is implemented by wiring a dashboard-level navigation callback (e.g., AppShell’s setCurrentPage) into StudentDashboardPage and binding it to the quick-action card click handlers.
Quick-action cards remain visually clickable and are keyboard-accessible (e.g., support Enter/Space activation) or are implemented with accessible interactive elements.

requirements.text: Update AppShell to pass the navigation handler into StudentDashboardPage without altering the existing Parent Dashboard behavior or the Header navigation behavior.

quotes: in dashboard if student clicks ai tutor and exam generator it needs to redirect to its respective page,update the code accordingly pls

acceptanceCriteria: Parent users still see ParentDashboardPage when on the dashboard view, and student-only navigation continues to function from the header.
No changes are required to backend canister methods or data models for this navigation fix.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything under frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
Keep routing/navigation consistent with the existing AppShell currentPage state model (do not introduce a new routing framework).
nonGoals: Adding new dashboard features beyond fixing navigation for the two quick-action tiles.
Changing the visual theme or redesigning dashboard layout.
Adding backend endpoints or modifying backend state for navigation.
